intro: Lasianthera perobtusa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences called cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Lasianthera perobtusa is also known for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in this family.
